headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Ticket Swindle Revived. The Police Commissioners. Academy of Medicine--November Meeting. Police Intelligence. AUDACIOUS ROBBERY. CHARGE OF MURDER.

docs.lead_paragraph: The law passed by the last Legistative ??? Ticket-swindling a felony punishable with fine and imprisonment, produced a temporary suspension of hostilities, and for a short time after its promulgation ?? wholesome fear kept the runners, and ?? ticket venders in check. The armistice, however, is again suspended, and hostilities have commenced with greater fierceness, If possible, than even before.
docs.abstract: Letter from F P Tallmadge on an Armed Police

headline.main: THE ELECTIONS.; REPUBLICAN MAJORITY IN THE SENATE. THE STATE PROBABLY DEMOCRATIC. NEW-YORK RETURNS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The returns of the Election in this State are still far from complete. The state is probalbly Democratic, but the Republicans have elected 18 out of the 32 Senators, securing a continuance of their majority in that body. The Assembly is probably Democratice; we have returns electing 103 members of whom 51 are Democrats and 52 Republicans, with about half the Assembly Districts to hear from.
docs.snippet: The returns of the Election in this State are still far from complete. The state is probalbly Democratic, but the Republicans have elected 18 out of the 32 Senators, securing a continuance of their majority in that body. The Assembly is probably...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Election in this State has gone to the Democrats by about 8,000 plurallty over the Republicans, so far as heard from. The returns yet to come in will not materially affect the general result. The Democrats have also probably elected a majority of the Members of Assembly.

headline.main: Later from Havana.; ARRIVAL OF THE CAHAWBA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamer Cahawba, J. D. BULLOCK, Commander, from New Orleans via Havana, having left the latter port on the 30th ult., arrived at this port yesterday morning. There is nothing new at Havana. It is reported that several loads of Africans had been landed.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF TIIE STAR OF THE WEST; ADDITIONAL FROM CALIFORNIA. One Month Later from the South Pacifc. INTERESTING FROM NEW-GRANDA. Very Important from Central America. ANNULMENT OF THE WEBSTER TRANSIT GRANT. A MILLION AND A HALF IN TREASURE Seizure and Blockade of the San Juan River by Costa Rica.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Mail steamship Star of the West, A. G. GRAY commanding from Aspinwall on the night of the 24th ult., vid Havana, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The news from San Francisco has been anticipated by the arrival of the Quaker City from Havana.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Effect of the Panic on the Manufacturing Towns of Great Britain. TRADE IN FRANCE. CONSOLS UNCHANGED. Wreck of American Vessels. Further Discount Advances in France, England and Hamburg. ARRIVAL OF THE ARAGO. THE FINANCIAL CRISIS ABROAD $220,000 in Specie on Board.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Arago, Captain LINES, arrived yesterday morning from Southampton, with the French and English mails and advices from London to the 21st October. The Arage brings 300 passengers, the usual malls, $220,000 in specie and 250 tons merchandise.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Judge Ingersell. S. W. Calvert vs. Heman J. Redfield. This was an action against the defendant as Collector of the Port, to recover certain extra duties imposed by him on every-stone imported by the plaintiff, which on appraisement was advanced in value more than 10 per cent, above the invoice. The importer was dissatisfied with the appraisement, and wrote to the Collector requesting a reappraisement and inclosing the fees therefor.

headline.main: THREE WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; NEWS FROM HAVANA. $1,600,000 EN ROUTE FOR NEW-YORK. The Star of the West at Havana. ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Quaker City, Captain SHUFELBT, from Mobile the 27th and Havana at 5 P.M. on the 20th, arrived here yesterday afternoon, four days from the later port. The Quaker City made the run from Mobile Bar to Havana in 40 hours. From Havana there, is nothing of interest to report.
